job_description: Tax Senior Analyst Dell Technologies is a global, multi-billion-dollar corporation, so our Tax team has a huge task in ensuring that we meet our tax obligations. It’s a wide-ranging area – from tax research, planning and compliance, through to developing and implementing systems to support data collection, analysis, preparation and submission. Whether preparing and completing tax returns and reports, catching up with the latest developments in tax law or answering enquiries from a host of internal and external customers, we’re always switched on and on top of our game. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Tax Senior Analyst on our Tax team in Bratislava, Slovakia. What you’ll achieve As a Tax Senior Analyst , you will be responsible for supporting corporate tax compliance and planning, and US quarterly reporting. You will work with statutory accountants and external tax advisors on annual corporate tax returns. You will: Prepare C orporate income tax return compliance, including review of externally prepared corporate income tax returns for various Dell legal entities across EMEA ; c alculation, review and approval of corporate income tax payments (advance or actual payments) and r eview of financial statements to ensure tax compliance. CIT accounting under US GAAP, IFRS/local GAAP (review quarterly and yearly tax provisions, cash tax forecasts, and provision to return as well as assessment of uncertain tax positions) . Provide advice on EMEA intercompany recharge queries and partner ing with the business to find tax compliant solutions to cross region recharges; Support the EMEA Tax Manager s during tax audits / tax inquires . Assist with transfer pricing documentation and compliance and h elp with Group projects, including potential M&A activity, new transactions within our existing business and tax reviews of ongoing business activities . Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements Minimum of 2-3 years of corporate tax experience or qualified accountant with statutory accounting experience Masters Degree in Tax Fluent business English with experience of working in multinational environment Knowledge of European tax compliance, by experience and / or training Detailed oriented with analytical skills Able to prioritize work load in order to meet compliance deadlines and business demands ​ ​ Desirable Requirements The ability and willingness to pick up and develop technical knowledge on the job, through formal training sessions and through self-education; Prior knowledge of EMEA/US direct tax compliance an advantage but not essential Salary starting from: 1 800 EUR gross/month Dell’s Flexible & Hybrid Work Culture At Dell Technologies, we believe our best work is done when flexibility is offered. We know that freedom and flexibility are crucial to all our employees no matter where you are located and our flexible and hybrid work style allows team members to have the freedom to ideate, be innovative, and drive results their way. To learn more about our work culture, please visit our locations page. Benefits: Private medical care, Sick days, Access into our Learning studio – more than 1,000 online trainings, Extra vacation , Private employee gym . To see the full list of benefits, click HERE .
